displayed_text: Thank you for your valuable contributions to our study! Our goal is to understand how doctors can communicate better with patients by looking at different perceptions of the doctors’ qualities. Understanding your personal experiences with the medical system will help us to contextualize your responses. We invite you to share insights by answering the following questions. Your answers to these questions are strictly confidential and anonymous.

About how long has it been since you las.Within the last 2 years (1 year but less: About how long has it been since you last saw a doctor or other health professional about your health?:::Within the last 2 years (1 year but less than 2 years ago)

During the past 12 months, not counting.None: During the past 12 months, not counting times you went to an emergency room, how many times did you go to a doctor, nurse, or other health professional to get care for yourself?:::None

Sometimes doctors care more about what i.strongly agree: Sometimes doctors care more about what is convenient for them than about their patients' medical needs.:::strongly agree

Doctors are extremely thorough and caref.disagree: Doctors are extremely thorough and careful.:::disagree

You completely trust doctors' decisions.disagree: You completely trust doctors' decisions about which medical treatments are best.:::disagree

A doctor would never mislead you about a.disagree: A doctor would never mislead you about anything.:::disagree

All in all, you trust doctors completely.disagree: All in all, you trust doctors completely.:::disagree

People of my ethnic group receive the sa.agree: People of my ethnic group receive the same medical care from doctors and healthcare workers as people from other groups:::agree

People of my ethnic group are treated th.agree: People of my ethnic group are treated the same as people of other groups by doctors and healthcare workers:::agree

Doctors have the best interests of peopl.agree: Doctors have the best interests of people of my ethnic group in mind:::agree

Which of the following best describe you.Employed: Which of the following best describe your current occupational status? Mark all that apply.:::Employed

What is the highest grade or level of s.College graduate: What is the highest grade or level of schooling you completed?:::College graduate

Are you of Hispanic or Latino origin or.Yes, Hispanic or Latino: Are you of Hispanic or Latino origin or descent?:::Yes, Hispanic or Latino

What race or races do you consider yours.White: What race or races do you consider yourself to be?:::White

Please feel free to leave any comments a.text_box: Some of these Doctors need to be more concerned with their bedside mann r rather than only caring about the he clinical aspect of things. Some of these Doctor’s were terrible!!! I’d NEVER go back to see som of them for a second visit!!!

displayed_text: Patient: And he’s said he’s had good luck with other patients that have had pain with that Cymbalta. Doctor: In the joints? I mean I don’t know how it will help with that with your pain, but you know what it’s definitely worth a try. I have no objections to giving that a try but I’m not terribly hopeful, but if he’s seen something different in his experience. Patient: Well if that’s the case I’ll just stay on the prednisone. Forget that. I mean it’s not something Doctor: Okay I mean I’m okay if you want to give that a try Patient: Yeah, yeah. Doctor: and there’s no objection or problem - Patient: Okay. Doctor: from the study standpoint. Patient: Alright, Okay. Family Member: Which is the lesser of the two evils as far as taking it long term? I’m not familiar with Cymbalta. Doctor: Well, I think Cymbalta is probably you know much more proven you know long term. The steroids can have other issues of you know blocking the immune systems likely increased risk of infections and things like that over the long term, but you know it’s – I kind of think it’s unlikely that it will help arthritic pain. If it is neuropathic nerve pain and stuff, you know Cymbalta can be effective. Patient: Yeah I think that’s what he said also yeah. Doctor: I don’t think that is the reason for your pain, but that’s my impression.

Patient: It doesn’t blink. The eye’s not going to blink. But, you know. Doctor: Did they scan your brain or anything? Patient: I did a, I did a, in my, huh, in my, in my eye hit at the Doctor: Because it’s gotten worse. Patient: What? Doctor: I mean, your face is even- Patient: Well, one thing, I said the wrong side. It’s not the right side. It’s the left side. Doctor: Uh-huh. Patient: But I’m starting to think I . I wouldn’t even do that. Doctor: So it got a little worse from when you saw me but actually it hasn’t gotten worse in the last week or so? Patient: Right. Doctor: Okay. Okay. Okay. So there’s only one medicine on here that I’m looking at. Huh, do you take acyclovir? Did they put you on that? Patient: Yeah.
